pageContext.claim: “They could solve that problem in New York. All they'd have to do is let them do their job and don't take $1 billion away and fire some of the best people on the force, which is what they did.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump is mashing together two separate stories here. Cuts to the New York Police Department came as part of a budget passed over the summer, reflecting the revenue shortfalls the city experienced as a result of covid-19. In other words, they have not happened yet and consequently, cannot yet be blamed for rising crime rates. Moreover, there is no evidence that the NYPD was stifled in its policing duties.
